tuv.seg: Appealing a planning permission decision
Achomharc a dhéanamh ar chead pleanála

A person applying for planning permission and any person who made written submissions or observations to the planning authority on a planning application can appeal a planning decision made by a local authority to An Bord Pleanála

Is féidir le duine a dhéanann iarratas ar chead pleanála agus aon duine a thug cuntas scríofa nó a nochtaigh tuairimí don údarás pleanála maidir le iarratas pleanála achomharc a lorg ar chinneadh a rinne údarás áitiúil chuig An mBord Pleanála
For example, you can:
Mar shampla is féidir leat:
• Appeal against a refusal to grant you planning permission or conditions attached to your permission or
• Achomharc a lorg ar chinneadh cead pleanála a dhiúltú duit nó i dtaobh na gcoinníollacha a bhaineann leis an gcead sin, nó
• Appeal against a decision to give someone else planning permission (this is called a third party appeal)
• Achomharc a lorg ar chinneadh cead pleanála a thabhairt do dhuine eile (dá ngairfear achomharc tríú duine)
In this case you must have made a written submission/observation to the planning authority on the relevant application*
Sa chás seo, ní mór duit cuntas scríofa nó a nochtaigh tuairimí don údarás pleanála maidir leis an iarratas ábhartha a thugadh
*There are 3 exceptions to the requirement to have made prior submissions or observations:
*Tá 3 eisceacht ón gcoinníoll go gcaithfear aighneacht a dhéanamh roimh ré cuntas scríofa nó a nochtaigh tuairimí a thabhairt:
If a prescribed body was not notified in accordance with law, they may appeal without having made a submission or observation on the planning application
Is féidir le comhlacht ainmnithe achomharc a dhéanamh murar tugadh fógra dóibh de réir an dlí gan aighneacht a bheith déanta/tuairimí a bheith nochta acu i dtaobh an iarratais phleanála

If an environmental impact statement (EIS) was required to be submitted with the planning application, a body that promotes environmental protection and meets certain other requirements may appeal the decision without have made a submission or observation

Má caitheadh ráiteas tionchair timpeallachta leis an iarratas pleanála a chur isteach, is féidir comhlacht a chuireann cosaint chomhshaoil chun cinn agus a shásaíonn riachtanais áirithe eile achomharc ar chinneadh a dhéanamh gan aon chuntas scríofa nó tuairimí déanta acu
A person who has an interest in adjoining lands where permission has been granted can apply to the Board for leave to appeal the decision without having made a submission or observation

Is féidir le duine a bhfuil leas aige/aici i dtailte cóngaracha áit a bhfuil cead pleanála tugtha iarratas a chur chuig an Bord ar chead achomharc a dhéanamh gan aighneacht a bheith déanta/tuairimí a bheith nochta acu
If an appeal has already been made by either the applicant and/or a valid third party, any other person can become an "observer" and make submissions or observations
Má tá achomharc déanta cheana ag an iarrthóir agus/nó ag duine cuí den tríú páirtí is féidir le duine ar bith eile a bheith ina 'b(h)reathnadóir' agus pointí nó tuairimí a nochtadh ar an gcás
A valid appellant may request an oral hearing on payment of an additional fee
Má íocann tú táille bhreise is féidir éisteacht bhéil a iarraidh
An Bord Pleanála will normally only grant an oral hearing if the case is particularly complex or significant national or local issues are involved
De ghnáth ní bheidh An Bord Pleanála sásta éisteacht bhéil a cheadú ach amháin sa chás gur ceist chasta atá inti agus go bhfuil ceisteanna móra náisiúnta nó áitiúla ag baint leis an scéal
An Bord Pleanála aims to make a decision within 18 weeks
Tá sé mar aidhm ag An mBord Pleanála cinneadh a dhéanamh taobh istigh de 18 seachtainí
If this is not possible, it will inform all the parties of this
Muna bhfuil sé seo indéanta cuirfear scéal chuig na daoine ar fad a bhfuil baint acu leis an gcás
In general, An Bord Pleanála will either:
Déanfaidh An Bord Pleanála ceann de na rudaí seo a leanas:
• Grant planning permission with conditions, or
• Cuirfidh sé cead pleanála ar fáil le coinníollacha áirid, nó
An Bord Pleanála's decision is final and can only be challenged by judicial review in the High Court
Níl aon dul siar ar chinneadh ón mBord Pleanála ach amháin athbhreithniú dleathúil a lorg ón Ard Chúirt
This process will judge whether the Board followed due process in reaching its decision and will not include an examination of the planning merits

Ní dhéanfar scrúdú ar na buntáistí pleanála a bhaineann leis an gcás mar chuid den athbhreithniú cúirte, déanfaidh an Chúirt cinneadh ar lean, nó nár lean An Bord Pleanála an córas cuí agus cinneadh dhá dhéanamh
Files on appeals received by the Board can be inspected by members of the public after the appeals have been determined by the Board
Is féidir leis an bpobal breathnú ar chódanna a bhaineann le cásanna a cuireadh ós comhair an Bhoird tar éis cinneadh a bheith déanta ag an mBord orthu
These files can be inspected, free of charge, at the Board's offices for a period of at least 5 years after the appeal decision
Tá na códanna seo le feiceáil, saor in aisce, in oifigí an Bhoird ar feadh tréimhse de 5 bliana ar a laghad tar éis an chinnithe a bheith tógta orthu
You must make the appeal to An Bord Pleanála within 4 weeks of the decision by the local authority
Ní mór achomharc a chur ós comhair An Bhord Phleanála taobh istigh de 4 sheachtain ón am a dhéanann an t-údarás áitiúil cinneadh
Your appeal must include the following:
Ní mór na nithe seo a leanas a bheith san achomharc
• Your own name and address
• D'ainm agus do sheoladh;
• Details of the proposed development, the name of the local authority, the planning register number and (if you are a third party) the applicant's name and address
• Sonraí maidir leis an bhforbairt atá beartaithe, ainm an údaráis áitiúil, uimhir chláraithe pleanála agus (más tú an tríú duine) ainm agus seoladh an iarrthóra
• The full grounds of the appeal with supporting material and arguments
• Fáthanna iomlán an achomhairc chomh maith le hábhar tacaíochta agus argóintí
No further submissions or elaborations on these grounds of appeal can be accepted by the Board
Ní bheidh an Bord in ann glacadh ina dhiaidh sin le cuntais bhreise nó le heolas breise maidir leis an fáthanna seo
The grounds of the appeal must relate to planning issues only
Ní mór gur ceisteanna pleanála amháin is cúis leis an achomharc
The Board cannot take other issues into consideration
Ní féidir leis an mBord ceisteanna eile a chur san áireamh
• If you are a third party appellant, an acknowledgement from the planning authority that you made a submission or observations on the application to it
• Más tú an tríú duine, ní mór duit admháil a bheith agat ón údarás áitiúil gur chuir tú cuntas nó tuairimí ós a chomhair maidir leis an iarratas seo
If you do not submit all the documentation, the appeal will be considered invalid and cannot be considered by An Bord Pleanála
Muna mbíonn na cáipéisí cuí uilig curtha ar fáil agat, ní bheidh an t-achomharc bailí agus ní bheidh an Bord Pleanála in ann breathnú air
You will be charged a fee if you wish to make an appeal to An Bord Pleanála
Tá táille le n-íoc ar achomharc a chur ós comhair An Bhord Phleanála
The fee for making an appeal depends on the type of case and the relevant legislation
Ní mór achomharc i scríbhinn a dhéanamh chuig an Rúnaí, An Bord Pleanála ag an seoladh thíos
